00066 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC
00067 #define sched_malloc(size)              rt_malloc((size))
00068 #define sched_free(adr)                 rt_free((adr))
00069 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN
00070 #define sched_mem_init()
00071 #define sched_mem_end()
00072 #else  /* CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN */
00073 #define sched_mem_init() \
00074         { if(rt_mem_init() != 0) { \
00075                 printk("Failed to allocate memory for task stack(s)\n"); \
00076                 return(-ENOMEM); \
00077         } }
00078 #define sched_mem_end()                 rt_mem_end()
00079 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN */
00080 #define call_exit_handlers(task)                __call_exit_handlers(task)
00081 #define set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2) __set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2)
00082 #else  /* !CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC */
00083 #define sched_malloc(size)      kmalloc((size), GFP_KERNEL)
00084 #define sched_free(adr)         kfree((adr))
00085 #define sched_mem_init()
00086 #define sched_mem_end()
00087 #define call_exit_handlers(task)
00088 #define set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2)
00089 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC */

00125 extern unsigned long sqilter;
00126 
00127 #define SCHED_IPI     RTAI_3_IPI
00128 #define SCHED_VECTOR  RTAI_3_VECTOR
00129 
00130 static inline void send_sched_ipi(unsigned long dest)
00131 {
00132 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS
00133         unsigned long flags;
00134         arti_hw_lock(flags);
00135 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS */
00136         apic_wait_icr_idle();
00137         apic_write_around(APIC_ICR2, SET_APIC_DEST_FIELD(dest));
00138         apic_write_around(APIC_ICR, APIC_DEST_LOGICAL | SCHED_VECTOR);
00139 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS
00140         arti_hw_unlock(flags);
00141 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS */
00142 }
00143 
00144 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP(schedmap) \
00145 do { \
00146         if (sqilter) { \
00147                 if (schedmap) send_sched_ipi(schedmap); \
00148         } else { \
00149                 rt_schedule(); \
00150         } \
00151 } while (0)
00152 
00153 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP_BOTH(schedmap) \
00154 do { \
00155         if (sqilter && schedmap) send_sched_ipi(schedmap); \
00156         rt_schedule(); \
00157 } while (0)
00158 
00159 #define RT_SCHEDULE(task, cpuid) \
00160         do { \
00161                 if (((task)->runnable_on_cpus != (cpuid)) && sqilter) { \
00162                         send_sched_ipi(1 << (task)->runnable_on_cpus); \
00163                 } else { \
00164                         rt_schedule(); \
00165                 } \
00166         } while (0)
00167 
00168 #define RT_SCHEDULE_BOTH(task, cpuid) \
00169         { \
00170                 if (((task)->runnable_on_cpus != (cpuid)) && sqilter) { \
00171                         send_sched_ipi(1 << (task)->runnable_on_cpus); \
00172                 } \
00173                 rt_schedule(); \
00174         }
00175 
00176 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00177 
00178 #define send_sched_ipi(dest)
00179 
00180 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP_BOTH(schedmap)  rt_schedule()
00181 
00182 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP(schedmap)       rt_schedule()
00183 
00184 #define RT_SCHEDULE(task, cpuid)        rt_schedule()
00185 
00186 #define RT_SCHEDULE_BOTH(task, cpuid)   rt_schedule()
00187 
00188 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00189 
00190 #define BASE_SOFT_PRIORITY 1000000000
00191 
00192 #define TASK_HARDREALTIME  TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE
00193 
00194 static inline void enq_ready_edf_task(RT_TASK *ready_task)
00195 {
00196         RT_TASK *task;
00197 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00198         task = rt_smp_linux_task[ready_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].rnext;
00199 #else
00200         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].rnext;
00201 #endif
00202         while (task->policy < 0 && ready_task->period >= task->period) {
00203                 task = task->rnext;
00204         }
00205         task->rprev = (ready_task->rprev = task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task;
00206         ready_task->rnext = task;
00207 }
00208 
00209 #define MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ (2 << 6)
00210 
00211 struct klist_t { volatile int srq, in, out; void *task[MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ]; };
00212 extern struct klist_t wake_up_srq;
00213 
00214 static inline void enq_ready_task(RT_TASK *ready_task)
00215 {
00216         RT_TASK *task;
00217         if (ready_task->is_hard) {
00218 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00219                 task = rt_smp_linux_task[ready_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].rnext;
00220 #else
00221                 task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].rnext;
00222 #endif
00223                 while (ready_task->priority >= task->priority) {
00224                         if ((task = task->rnext)->priority < 0) break;
00225                 }
00226                 task->rprev = (ready_task->rprev = task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task;
00227                 ready_task->rnext = task;
00228         } else {
00229                 ready_task->state = 0;
00230                 wake_up_srq.task[wake_up_srq.in] = ready_task->lnxtsk;
00231                 wake_up_srq.in = (wake_up_srq.in + 1) & (MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ - 1);
00232                 rt_pend_linux_srq(wake_up_srq.srq);
00233         }
00234 }
00235 
00236 static inline int renq_ready_task(RT_TASK *ready_task, int priority)
00237 {
00238         int retval;
00239         if ((retval = ready_task->priority != priority)) {
00240                 ready_task->priority = priority;
00241                 if (ready_task->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00242                         (ready_task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task->rnext;
00243                         (ready_task->rnext)->rprev = ready_task->rprev;
00244                         enq_ready_task(ready_task);
00245                 }
00246         }
00247         return retval;
00248 }
00249 
00250 static inline int renq_current(RT_TASK *rt_current, int priority)
00251 {
00252         int retval;
00253         if ((retval = rt_current->priority != priority)) {
00254                 rt_current->priority = priority;
00255                 (rt_current->rprev)->rnext = rt_current->rnext;
00256                 (rt_current->rnext)->rprev = rt_current->rprev;
00257                 enq_ready_task(rt_current);
00258         }
00259         return retval;
00260 }
00261 
00262 static inline void rem_ready_task(RT_TASK *task)
00263 {
00264         if (task->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00265                 if (!task->is_hard) {
00266                         (task->lnxtsk)->state = TASK_HARDREALTIME;
00267                 }
00268                 (task->rprev)->rnext = task->rnext;
00269                 (task->rnext)->rprev = task->rprev;
00270         }
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline void rem_ready_current(RT_TASK *rt_current)
00274 {
00275         if (!rt_current->is_hard) {
00276                 (rt_current->lnxtsk)->state = TASK_HARDREALTIME;
00277         }
00278         (rt_current->rprev)->rnext = rt_current->rnext;
00279         (rt_current->rnext)->rprev = rt_current->rprev;
00280 }
00281 
00282 static inline void enq_timed_task(RT_TASK *timed_task)
00283 {
00284         RT_TASK *task;
00285 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00286         task = rt_smp_linux_task[timed_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].tnext;
00287 #else
00288         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext;
00289 #endif
00290         while (timed_task->resume_time > task->resume_time) {
00291                 task = task->tnext;
00292         }
00293         task->tprev = (timed_task->tprev = task->tprev)->tnext = timed_task;
00294         timed_task->tnext = task;
00295 }
00296 
00297 static inline void wake_up_timed_tasks(int cpuid)
00298 {
00299         RT_TASK *task;
00300 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00301         task = rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid = cpuid & sqilter].tnext;
00302 #else
00303         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext;
00304 #endif
00305         while (task->resume_time <= rt_time_h) {
00306                 if ((task->state &= ~(RT_SCHED_DELAYED | RT_SCHED_SEMAPHORE | RT_SCHED_RECEIVE | RT_SCHED_SEND | RT_SCHED_RPC | RT_SCHED_RETURN | RT_SCHED_MBXSUSP)) == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00307                         if (task->policy < 0) {
00308                                 enq_ready_edf_task(task);
00309                         } else {
00310                                 enq_ready_task(task);
00311                         }
00312                 }
00313                 task = task->tnext;
00314         }
00315 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00316         rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid].tnext = task;
00317         task->tprev = &rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid];
00318 #else
00319         rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext = task;
00320         task->tprev = &rt_smp_linux_task[0];
00321 #endif
00322 }
00323 
00324 static inline void rem_timed_task(RT_TASK *task)
00325 {
00326         if ((task->state & RT_SCHED_DELAYED)) {
00327                 (task->tprev)->tnext = task->tnext;
00328                 (task->tnext)->tprev = task->tprev;
00329         }
00330 }

00332 #define get_time() rt_get_time()
00333 #if 0
00334 static inline RTIME get_time(void)
00335 {
00336 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00337         if (sqilter) {
00338                 int cpuid;
00339                 return rt_smp_oneshot_timer[cpuid = hard_cpu_id()] ? rdtsc() : rt_smp_times[cpuid].tick_time;
00340         } else {
00341                 return rt_smp_oneshot_timer[0] ? rdtsc(): rt_times.tick_time;
00342         }
00343 #else
00344         return oneshot_timer ? rdtsc(): rt_times.tick_time;
00345 #endif
00346 }
00347 #endif
00348 
00349 static inline void enqueue_blocked(RT_TASK *task, QUEUE *queue, int qtype)
00350 {
00351         QUEUE *q;
00352         task->blocked_on = (q = queue);
00353         if (!qtype) {
00354                 while ((q = q->next) != queue && (q->task)->priority <= task->priority);
00355         }
00356         q->prev = (task->queue.prev = q->prev)->next  = &(task->queue);
00357         task->queue.next = q;
00358 }
00359 
00360 
00361 static inline void dequeue_blocked(RT_TASK *task)
00362 {
00363         task->prio_passed_to     = NOTHING;
00364         (task->queue.prev)->next = task->queue.next;
00365         (task->queue.next)->prev = task->queue.prev;
00366         task->blocked_on         = NOTHING;
00367 }
00368 
00369 static __volatile__ inline unsigned long pass_prio(RT_TASK *to, RT_TASK *from)
00370 {
00371         QUEUE *q;
00372 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00373         unsigned long schedmap;
00374         schedmap = 0;
00375 #endif
00376         from->prio_passed_to = to;
00377         while (to && to->priority > from->priority) {
00378                 to->priority = from->priority;
00379                 if (to->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00380                         (to->rprev)->rnext = to->rnext;
00381                         (to->rnext)->rprev = to->rprev;
00382                         enq_ready_task(to);
00383 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00384                         set_bit(to->runnable_on_cpus & 0x1F, &schedmap);
00385 #endif
00386                 } else if ((q = to->blocked_on) && !((to->state & RT_SCHED_SEMAPHORE) &&
00387  ((SEM *)q)->qtype)) {
00388                         (to->queue.prev)->next = to->queue.next;
00389                         (to->queue.next)->prev = to->queue.prev;
00390                         while ((q = q->next) != to->blocked_on && (q->task)->priority <= to->priority);
00391                         q->prev = (to->queue.prev = q->prev)->next  = &(to->queue);
00392                         to->queue.next = q;
00393                 }
00394                 to = to->prio_passed_to;
00395         }
00396 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00397         return schedmap;
00398 #else
00399         return 0;
00400 #endif
00401 }

00403 static inline RT_TASK *_rt_whoami(void)
00404 {
00405 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00406         RT_TASK *rt_current;
00407         unsigned long flags;
00408         flags = rt_global_save_flags_and_cli();
00409         rt_current = RT_CURRENT;
00410         rt_global_restore_flags(flags);
00411         return rt_current;
00412 #else
00413         return rt_smp_current[0];
00414 #endif
00415 }
00416 
00417 static inline void __call_exit_handlers(RT_TASK *task)
00418 {
00419         XHDL *pt, *tmp;
00420 
00421         pt = task->ExitHook; // Initialise ExitHook in rt_task_init()
00422         while ( pt ) {
00423                 (*pt->fun) (pt->arg1, pt->arg2);
00424                 tmp = pt;
00425                 pt  = pt->nxt;
00426                 rt_free(tmp);
00427         }
00428         task->ExitHook = 0;
00429 }
00430 
00431 static inline XHDL *__set_exit_handler(RT_TASK *task, void (*fun) (void *, int), void *arg1, int arg2)
00432 {
00433         XHDL *p;
00434 
00435         // exit handler functions are automatically executed at terminattion time by rt_task_delete()
00436         // in the reverse order they were created (like C++ destructors behave).
00437         if (task->magic != RT_TASK_MAGIC) return 0;
00438         if (!(p = (XHDL *) rt_malloc (sizeof(XHDL)))) return 0;
00439         p->fun  = fun;
00440         p->arg1 = arg1;
00441         p->arg2 = arg2;
00442         p->nxt  = task->ExitHook;
00443         return (task->ExitHook = p);
00444 }
